name: Refinitiv
goal:
On 1 October 2018, the Financial & Risk business of Thomson Reuters became Refinitiv following the closing of the partnership deal between Thomson Reuters and private equity funds managed by Blackstone, which will own 55% of Refinitiv, with 45% remaining under Thomson Reuters ownership.

Serving more than 40,000 institutions in over 190 countries, Refinitiv provides information, insights and technology that drive innovation and performance in global financial markets. Our heritage of integrity enables our customers to make critical decisions with confidence while our best-in-class data and cutting-edge technologies enable greater opportunity.

We enable the financial community to trade smarter and faster, overcome regulatory challenges, and scale intelligently.
interests: Competition, Digital economy and society, Economy, finance and the euro, Research and innovation, Single market, Trade
euInitiatives:
We mainly follow EU policies related relating to data legislation, including market data and data protection, sustainability & ESG, FX trading, financial innovation and the digital economy, financial crime as well as international trade. Furthermore, we follow the Brexit developments.

Examples include:

Sustainable finance
Capital Markets Union
Anti Money Laundering Directive
EU Benchmark Regulation
Data Protection Regulation
Trade agreements
Financial Transaction Tax
Markets in Financial Instruments Directive/ Regulation
